title: Dragon Ball
author: Akira Toriyama
description: Follows the adventures of Goku from his childhood through adulthood as he trains in martial arts and explores the world in search of the seven wish-granting orbs known as the Dragon Balls.

title: One Piece
author: Eiichiro Oda
description: The adventure of Monkey D. Luffy, a boy whose body gained the properties of rubber after unintentionally eating a Devil Fruit, and his diverse crew of pirates, named the Straw Hat Pirates.

title: Naruto
author: Masashi Kishimoto
description: Tells the story of Naruto Uzumaki, a young ninja who seeks recognition from his peers and dreams of becoming the Hokage, the leader of his village.

title: Bleach
author: Tite Kubo
description: The story of Ichigo Kurosaki, a teenager with the ability to see ghosts, who obtains the powers of a Soul Reaper and takes on the duties of defending humans from evil spirits.

title: Attack on Titan
author: Hajime Isayama
description: Set in a world where humanity resides within three enormous walls that protect them from the gigantic man-eating humanoids referred to as Titans.

title: My Hero Academia
author: Kohei Horikoshi
description: In a world where people with superpowers known as 'Quirks' are the norm, a boy born without a Quirk dreams of becoming a superhero.

title: Demon Slayer
author: Koyoharu Gotouge
description: A young boy becomes a demon slayer to find a cure for his sister, who has been turned into a demon, and to avenge his family.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his new-found love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, of lavish parties on Long Island at a time when 'gin was the national drink and sex the national obsession'.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic novel about a young girl's coming-of-age in a Southern town and the moral crisis that rocks it, through the eyes of Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in Airstrip One, a province of the superstate Oceania in a world of perpetual war, omnipresent government surveillance, and public manipulation.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet, who learns the error of making hasty judgments.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City in the days following his expulsion from Pencey Prep, a prep school in Pennsylvania.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A survey of the history of humankind, from the Stone Age to the twenty-first century, focusing on key revolutions in human history.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir detailing the author's journey from growing up in a survivalist family in rural Idaho to earning a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: The memoir of former First Lady of the United States Michelle Obama, chronicling her life from childhood to her time in the White House.

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
description: Explores the science behind why we do what we do, and how we can change our habits for the better.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: Summarizes research that the author conducted over decades, explaining the two systems that drive the way we think.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A thriller about a woman who disappears on her fifth wedding anniversary, leaving her husband as the primary suspect.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A mystery thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon and cryptologist Sophie Neveu as they investigate a murder in Paris's Louvre Museum.

title: Big Little Lies
author: Liane Moriarty
description: A tale of three mothers of first-graders whose seemingly perfect lives unravel to the point of murder.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
description: Ten strangers are lured to an isolated island, only to be accused of past crimes and picked off one by one.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist and a young computer hacker team up to investigate the disappearance of a wealthy industrialist's niece from 40 years ago.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A science fiction epic set in the distant future amidst a feudal interstellar society in which various noble houses control planetary fiefs.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A washed-up computer hacker is hired by a mysterious employer to pull off the ultimate hack in this seminal cyberpunk novel.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: The story of a group of scientists who attempt to preserve humanity's knowledge and shorten a predicted dark age.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
description: In a futuristic Los Angeles, a pizza delivery guy who is also a hacker and samurai swordsman gets entangled in a plot involving a new computer virus.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut is mistakenly presumed dead and left behind on Mars, and must use his ingenuity to survive and find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive.

title: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A poignant love story about a young couple who are separated by social differences but find their way back to each other years later.

title: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A young woman forms an unlikely bond with a recently-paralyzed man she's taking care of.

title: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: A former World War II nurse finds herself transported back in time to 18th-century Scotland, where she falls for a dashing Highland warrior.

title: The Time Traveler’s Wife
author: Audrey Niffenegger
description: A love story about a man with a genetic disorder that causes him to time travel unpredictably, and the woman who tries to build a life with him.

title: Twilight
author: Stephenie Meyer
description: A teenage girl risks everything when she falls in love with a vampire.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A story about a young shepherd named Santiago who travels from his homeland in Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of a treasure buried near the Pyramids.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel that explores a futuristic World State of genetically modified citizens and an intelligence-based social hierarchy.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A powerful story of friendship, family, and redemption set against the devastating backdrop of the history of Afghanistan over the last thirty years.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones, offering a framework for improving every day.

title: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
description: A psychiatrist's memoir of his life in Nazi death camps and its lessons for spiritual survival.

title: Quiet: The Power of Introverts
author: Susan Cain
description: Argues that we dramatically undervalue introverts and shows how much we lose in doing so.

title: Outliers
author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: Examines the factors that contribute to high levels of success, arguing that the 'self-made man' is a myth.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A shocking psychological thriller of a woman’s act of violence against her husband—and of the therapist obsessed with uncovering her motive.

title: In the Woods
author: Tana French
description: A detective and his partner investigate the murder of a twelve-year-old girl in a small town in Ireland, a case that has eerie similarities to the detective's own past.

title: The Woman in the Window
author: A.J. Finn
description: An agoraphobic woman living alone in New York begins spying on her new neighbors, only to witness a disturbing act of violence.

title: The Reversal
author: Michael Connelly
description: Defense attorney Mickey Haller and LAPD Detective Harry Bosch team up to prove the innocence of a man who has been in prison for 24 years for a child murder.

title: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline
description: In a bleak future, a young man embarks on a virtual reality treasure hunt to win control of a vast digital universe and a massive fortune.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: A gifted young boy is sent to an advanced military school in space to prepare for a future invasion by a hostile alien race.

title: Hyperion
author: Dan Simmons
description: On the world of Hyperion, seven pilgrims set forth on a voyage to the Time Tombs, each with a desperate hope and a terrible secret.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A human ambassador is sent to the alien world of Gethen, a planet whose inhabitants can change their gender, to persuade them to join an interstellar confederation.

title: Red, White & Royal Blue
author: Casey McQuiston
description: The First Son of the United States falls in love with a British prince, and their secret romance could upend two nations.

title: Beach Read
author: Emily Henry
description: Two rival authors with writer's block make a deal to swap genres for the summer, leading to unexpected romance.

title: It Ends With Us
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A young woman's new relationship is threatened when her first love reappears, forcing her to confront her past.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
description: Two best friends with nothing in common except their annual summer vacation try to figure out what went wrong on their last trip.

title: The Notebooks of Leonardo da Vinci
author: Leonardo da Vinci
description: A collection of Leonardo da Vinci's drawings, ideas, and observations on art, science, and invention, offering a glimpse into the mind of a genius.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The personal diary of Anne Frank, a Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis in Amsterdam during World War II. A powerful testament to the human spirit.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: A series of personal writings by the Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, recording his private notes to himself and ideas on Stoic philosophy.

title: Darwin's Notebooks
author: Charles Darwin
description: The private journals and notebooks of Charles Darwin, where he first formulated his groundbreaking theories on evolution and natural selection.

title: Radioactive Substances
author: Marie Curie
description: Marie Curie's groundbreaking doctoral thesis and research notes on radioactivity, which laid the foundation for much of modern physics and chemistry.
